Create Underrepresented Ecosystems Raster Based on IUCN GET and Protection Gaps

make_underrepresented_ecosystems.Rd

This function calculates the representation gap of ecosystems defined in the IUCN Global Ecosystem Typology (GET) dataset, identifying those that fall short of a 30% protection target. The resulting raster layer indicates the average degree of underrepresentation across each planning unit.

Usage

make_underrepresented_ecosystems(
  iucn_get_directory,
  iso3,
  pus,
  boundary_layer = boundary_layer,
  current_protected_areas = NULL,
  iucn_get_prefixes = NULL,
  include_minor_occurrence = TRUE,
  output_path = NULL
)

Arguments

iucn_get_directory

Character. Path to the directory containing the IUCN GET .gpkg files.

iso3

Character. ISO3 country code (e.g., "KEN").

pus

A SpatRaster. Raster of planning units (e.g., from make_planning_units()).

boundary_layer

An sf object of the national boundary used to clip ecosystems.

current_protected_areas

Optional. An sf or SpatVector of protected areas. If NULL, data is fetched using make_protected_areas().

iucn_get_prefixes

Optional character vector. Filters .gpkg filenames by prefixes (e.g., c("T", "F")).

include_minor_occurrence

Logical. Whether to include ecosystems marked as "minor" (default = TRUE).

output_path

Optional character. Directory path to save the output raster.

Value

A normalised SpatRaster layer representing the average protection gap across ecosystems.

Details

The function uses spatial overlays to calculate the proportion of each ecosystem that is currently protected, computes the gap toward a 30% target, and then rasterizes this value onto the planning units. The output raster can be used to prioritise areas for protection of underrepresented ecosystems.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
underrep <- make_underrepresented_ecosystems(
  iucn_get_directory = "data/iucn_layers",
  boundary_layer = boundary_layer,
  iso3 = "KEN",
  pus = planning_units,
  output_path = "outputs"
)
} # }
